title: MicroserviceTestingConsumerDrivenContract - Q0001
text: What is the main goal of consumer-driven contract testing in microservices?

options.text: To ensure service providers meet consumer expectations

explanation: Consumer-driven contract testing ensures that service providers deliver APIs that meet the expectations defined by consumers.

title: MicroserviceTestingConsumerDrivenContract - Q0002
text: Who defines the contract in consumer-driven contract testing?
explanation: In consumer-driven contract testing, the consumer defines the contract that specifies how it expects the provider to behave.

title: MicroserviceTestingConsumerDrivenContract - Q0003
text: What is a contract in consumer-driven contract testing?

options.text: An agreement specifying expected API interactions

explanation: A contract defines the expected interactions between a consumer and a provider, including request and response formats.

title: MicroserviceTestingConsumerDrivenContract - Q0004
text: Which of the following tools is commonly used for consumer-driven contract testing?
explanation: Pact is a popular tool for implementing consumer-driven contract testing in microservice environments.

title: MicroserviceTestingConsumerDrivenContract - Q0005
text: What is the main benefit of consumer-driven contract testing?
explanation: Consumer-driven contract testing reduces integration issues by validating that providers meet consumer expectations before deployment.

title: MicroserviceTestingConsumerDrivenContract - Q0006
text: In consumer-driven contract testing, what does the provider verify?

options.text: That its API responses match the consumer’s contract
That the consumer’s UI is functional
That the database schema is correct
That the network configuration is valid

explanation: The provider verifies that its API responses conform to the expectations defined in the consumer’s contract.

title: MicroserviceTestingConsumerDrivenContract - Q0007
text: What is the role of a contract broker in consumer-driven contract testing?

options.text: To store and share contracts between consumers and providers

explanation: A contract broker stores and shares contracts between consumers and providers, enabling collaboration and version control.

title: MicroserviceTestingConsumerDrivenContract - Q0008
text: Which of the following best describes the workflow of consumer-driven contract testing?

options.text: Consumer defines contract → Provider verifies contract → Integration validated
Provider defines contract → Consumer verifies contract → Deployment
Consumer tests provider → Provider deploys → Consumer updates
Provider deploys → Consumer tests → Contract created

explanation: The typical workflow involves the consumer defining the contract, the provider verifying it, and integration being validated automatically.
